full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 33 of 228 709 LC2VMAX2 Rocchio - Direct 1 Q. Have you published articles on traumatic stress and interpersonal violence? 2 A. I have. 3 Q. Do you have any other involvement in professional publications? 4 A. I do. I'm on the editorial advisory board for the primary journal for the division of trauma psychology within the American Psychological Association. And I also serve as a peer reviewer for a number of other journals when topics come up that pertain to my areas of expertise. 5 Q. What does it mean to serve as a peer reviewer? 6 A. So when someone wants to have an article published, they will submit the article to the journal. And then the editors will send that article out to experts in the field to review the article and provide feedback as to whether the article should be accepted, whether significant or minor revisions are in order, or whether the article should be rejected for publication. 7 Q. Have you given presentations in the area of traumatic stress and interpersonal violence? 8 A. Yes, many. 9 Q. How did you come to give those presentations? 10 A. So there are really two ways that I've given presentations. One is through professional conferences, where you go through a very similar peer review process for professional organizations 11 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00017906

text_blocks.content: 1 Q. Have you published articles on traumatic stress and interpersonal violence? 2 A. I have. 3 Q. Do you have any other involvement in professional publications? 4 A. I do. I'm on the editorial advisory board for the primary journal for the division of trauma psychology within the American Psychological Association. And I also serve as a peer reviewer for a number of other journals when topics come up that pertain to my areas of expertise. 5 Q. What does it mean to serve as a peer reviewer? 6 A. So when someone wants to have an article published, they will submit the article to the journal. And then the editors will send that article out to experts in the field to review the article and provide feedback as to whether the article should be accepted, whether significant or minor revisions are in order, or whether the article should be rejected for publication. 7 Q. Have you given presentations in the area of traumatic stress and interpersonal violence? 8 A. Yes, many. 9 Q. How did you come to give those presentations? 10 A. So there are really two ways that I've given presentations. One is through professional conferences, where you go through a very similar peer review process for professional organizations
